newsitem.title: SPAIN: GOLF-KITE'S MASTERLY WEDGE SHOT AT THE LAST CLINCHES OKI PRO-AM.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-KITE'S MASTERLY WEDGE SHOT AT THE LAST CLINCHES OKI PRO-AM.

text.p: U.S. Ryder Cup captain Tom Kite played a masterly shot at the final hole to win the Oki Pro-Am European Tour event on Sunday.
Kite, 46, came to the 18th level with Argentine Angel Cabrera but then struck a 110-yard sand wedge just 18 inches from the pin and rolled in the putt for a winning birdie three.
It gave him a round of 70 for a 72-hole aggregate of 273, 15 under par. Cabrera, the overnight leader, shot 72 for 274.
European Ryder Cup captain Seve Ballesteros was third, equalling the best round of the day with 69 for 276.

Cabrera, who shot a course record 62 on Saturday, was one shot ahead of Kite with two holes to play and had victory in his grasp. But he three-putted the short 17th to allow the American to draw level and then came Kite's superb finish.
Even then Cabrera might have forced a play-off. He had a six-foot putt for a birdie at the 18th but the ball rolled past the edge of the hole.
Kite was delighted with his victory, saying: "I hadn't won for such a long time that I was beginning to wonder whether I would ever win again.
"I know there were a lot of good guys playing in the Dunhill Cup this week but here in Madrid we had a quality field."
Ballesteros, last but one out, played a quality round in strong wind and driving rain. He had five birdies in his first 12 holes and managed a par five at the 11th after going into the water.

"That penalty shot at the 11th proved the turning point," he said. "I began today five shots behind the leader and when I went out in 33 to close to one shot I thought I would win. But it was not to be."
